intro: Cliffortia flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the spring and summer months. Cliffortia flexuosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
